newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - U.S. Robotics up on bid.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - U.S. Robotics up on bid.

text.p: U.S. Robotics Corp shares soared preceding Thursday's U.S. market open to approach the friendly bid price for the company made by 3Com Corp, traders said.
In very active third market trade, U.S. Robotics stock traded at 68, up seven from last night's Nasdaq close.
Last night, the companies announced a stock-swap merger worth $6.6 billion, based on Tuesday's closing share prices.
Terms of the agreement call for each share of U.S. Robotics stock to be exchanged for 1.75 shares of 3Com.
3Com shares added 5/8 to 39-5/8 ahead of the market open.
Minutes later in pre-open activity, 3Com shares turned lower to trade in the 38 to 38-1/4 range, below last night's close regular market close.
"U.S. Robotics was up to 72 last night (in after-hours trade following the announcement) and it has come in a little bit," said a trader.
Indeed, both stocks reversed in tandem before the market open, with U.S. Robotics slipping to 66 as the morning progressed.
Novell Inc shares were weaker after the company reported fiscal first quarter earnings of $0.15 per share, $0.03 below Wall Street expectations, traders said.
The stock fell to 11 from 12-7/8 before the market open.
